meanings.definition: To bake (something) for too short a time.
meanings.sent1: She always underbakes her cookies, so they come out doughy.
meanings.sent2: The cake was underbaked and gooey in the middle.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally underbakes the bread, creating a new type of chewy loaf.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to underbake the pies makes them a hit at the bake sale.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the underbaking bread filled the kitchen with a warm aroma.

meanings.definition: Baked for too short a time.
meanings.sent1: The underbaked muffins were pale and not fully cooked.
meanings.sent2: The underbaked pizza crust was still soft and not crispy.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the underbaked cookies were perfect for those who like their treats extra soft.
meanings.sent4: The underbaked brownies were a disappointment, lacking the rich flavor of fully baked ones.
meanings.sent5: The underbaked bread had a dense texture and lacked the golden crust of a well-baked loaf.
